bow: parents what are the things you like daycare providers to know reverse question of the unwritten rules of daycare do know if it is just me or just related to the area where live it but there is such daycare shortage here that am uncomfortable communicating certain things to my daycare provider all the daycare handbooks have read allow them to stop accepting my child for any reason with week notice however it would take much longer than week to find new daycare for both of my kids it took months to find new daycare when they were first born and again later when they were older and we moved at my very first daycare they changed the policy so that payments happened through automatic withdrawls from my bank account initiated by them we expressed that we were comfortable with that and they told us that we had week to conform or our children were not welcome there perhaps that experience has me too on edge but here are the things am too afraid to tell them please stop making drop off procedures so complicated it is hard enough to get children under the age of to get out of the house in the morning asking the parent to then help their kid take off outdoor shoes and put on indoor shoes put on sunscreen put away their lunch get out their waterbottle use the bathroom wash their hands sign in on piece of paper and move rock with their name on it then rinse and repeat for second child while at the same time time am supposed to sign in on two different electronic systems four total across both rooms check the cubbies for supplies check the diaper table for other supplies check the lunch area for supplies take off my own shoes and wash my hands this means that drop off can take anywhere from 10 min to 45 min depending on the mood of my children ensure that your documentation is consistent often handbooks quick parent guides email communication etc have different info on how many sets of clothes whether or not to provide water bottle etc do tell my children you love them tell them they are awesome tell them that they make your day tell them you enjoy playing with them but do say you love them that is fair to children who need help understanding the difference between professional who will care for them during the day for period of time and family fictive kin who will be there for them for the rest of their lives if you love them but leave them when you find new job at new daycare how do they know at that they can trust other people in their lives who love them to stick around *stop asking me for donations understand the struggle of daycares but the struggle of working parents is real too pay more for daycare than would for in state tuition pay more on daycare for one child than do for two car payments do ask me to donate on top of it include your full needs in your rate so can understand the expense at the beginning of the year and decide accordingly agree with almost all of this especially the donations my kiddo only goes to daycare two days week but every single week since she started get pamphlet folder containing donation requests or fundraising the kid has had fundraisers since the start of school barely month ago don get it they also asked my husband and to file and see if we qualified for free reduced lunch which found really weird because knew we wouldn she doesn eat their lunch food anyway they said it doesn matter if she eats lunch through them or not if we qualified it means the daycare gets extra funding for the state found that super inappropriate the love thing is the only thing where would maybe be less stringent when worked in preschool we had full time kids who were there from 6am 6pm monday friday we never were encouraged to tell them we loved them exactly but if they said it to us we were allowed to say it back and we did love them we were with them the most out of any adult in their life feel like it was important to know we did reciprocate their love and that we cared very very much for them feel like the love comment is unintentionally cool babies and young children need closer caregiving touch and attention it absolutely essential for developing bonds through the rest of their lives this is an amazing read https www ncbi nlm nih gov pmc articles pmc5330336 it does beautiful job of explaining the importance of caregivers for babies toddlers pre school kids wish they knew they do have to make small chat if they do feel like it just want to get my kid and go home will not be offended if they are chatty this is so great have few more if you want me to start off the year by bringing in package of toilet paper and paper towels that fine mean we pay you 1000 mo but still guess just ask me to bring it all at once having to remember to go to the store every few weeks to pick up whichever personal care items you mandate me taking to daycare this month is beyond my capabilities as human right now could you just post online if your classes are filled and you are only accepting the waitlist must sit through an hour tour and in depth review of your policies to hear at the end of it all you are waitlisted until july 2020 hate wasting your time too but since you don respond to emails or answer registration questions on the phone here we are ugh the first one on your list is so true haven experienced this as parent yet but remember dropping off kid was babysitting for the day had her baby brother on my hip and walked her into her classroom she started her routine of hanging up her bag washing her hands and then switching her name over and whatever else and just stood back and watched their setup was small corner of the room that was filled with kids and parents bumping elbows trying to get it all done while also navigating around chairs that were way too close to where everyone was supposed to be teacher came up to me and spoke to me like was an idiot and tried to tell me you need to go help her with her drop off it part of what we do when kids come to preschool looked young but wasn and also had years of experience and certifications as preschool teacher myself in another state smiled back and gave her some spiel about developmental appropriateness in letting child control their own morning routine and that was supervising from where was at and then got little petty and said that in the classroom was the teacher for back home we had the space set up little better so that parents could help without bumping each other so much and that so couldn fit back there while holding little brother the teacher glared little but my friend had told her was only dropping off for the day so why would she expect me to know and do everything perfectly especially when the girl was clearly capable of doing it all solo swear some of these teachers need to get off of pinterest and start looking and the actual routine behind running classroom instead of just making kids jump through hoops to make the wall decorations look nice our first day care experience was rough to say the least long story short there was lot of movement in the infant room that was communicated with the parents before during or really after in addition to this there were some minor violations was noticing the director and owner of the daycare was known to be b\*tch and for fear of being kicked out if said anything to her went to dcf florida and filed an anonymous complaint by the end of the day she had kicked us out on friday afternoon to boot because dcf called them to let them know parent complained and guess the complaints were specific enough that she narrowed it down to us spent weeks trying to find daycare my job at the time sucked and would let me work from home so used up most of my dwindled leave balance from maternity leave and some leave without pay days it ridiculous what some daycares can get away with the shortage thing is real lived in florida and you had to be months pregnant to ensure spot by the time you had the kid and your leave was over and now live in nc and it more of the same that first one sounds crazy maybe because my little guy is still toddler but our drop off routine is sign paper sheet drop kid in front of teacher in classroom they tell us if he is low on supplies or needs something ve worked at various daycares in mn and fl for the past years and none are like this that insane we need really good reason to kick child out usually it because of violence but even then we work with the parents lot we encourage quick drop offs lingering can be confusing and sad for the child also saying love you to child is something that never done either what state do you live in this is insane my kids pre will literally stop you from coming in the room you show id you sign paper and you let them in the whole goal is to ease the transition even their elementary school only lets parents in the class for the first two days any time after you re not allowed on the blacktop unless there special event that lot and sorry they put you through that used to teach preschool our policy was sign in at the front office which you could do after you dropped off your kid help them wash their hands which we never enforced and no one ever did and drop kid off in class or daycare we had before after school care they did even have to help their kid bring in lunch most did or anything else they needed it was just sign in and drop off we accepted donations continuously and occasionally sent home flyers saying we needed whatever for school wide events but it was never mandated that is ridiculous you pay for your kid to be there you should have to provide extra on top of that think lot of it is short staffing we were lucky in that we were nonprofit and had volunteers and interns who did lot of work too but even then it took very little effort from parents and kids to get them signed in properly also briefly worked at another school without help and all they had to do was drop stuff off in their cubby those parents usually never even said hello to me agree about donations mostly because fully support suggested gifts to daycare workers but having hard time with the rest if dropoff is hard to handle with your own two kids imagine handling all of the things you mentioned with other people kids all of whom are completely different while earning minimum wage paycheck if they spent all their time doing the things you do want to do there would be no time to do the things that daycare preschool is all about and parents would be complaining about the lack of enrichment learning if they signed your kids in for you parents would be complaining about security issues and you do want people who are permanent fixtures in your kids life to love them no one is permanent fixture blanket forbidding the expression of love can go the other way showing your kid that these incredibly formative people might think they re cool but they do *love* them and that people who love them should always stay in their lives and generally think love=staying is really unhealthy lesson what happens when their best friend moves away when their grandparents move out of town whatever what happens if their uncle dies my kids run into their teachers arms and love you flies both ways almost every day there crazy rate of turnover at our daycare as at most daycares because apparently nobody who runs daycare wants to pay their workers enough to stay but we handle that by discussing it with our kids in all sorts of ways like *yes know it sad honey he still loves you but you know how mommy works to help pay for our house toys car food etc your teacher needs to do that too and he needed to go somewhere else to make enough money for that or *there were some other kids in the next town over who really needed teacher and she wanted to help but she loves you and she ll really miss you what was your favorite thing about her do you think your new teacher might do that or *your teacher really loves all of you kids but when she was little she wanted to be whatever career and now she gets to go do that is that awesome what do you want to be when you grow up you can even throw in an *i so glad that get to stay with you forever was preschool teacher for many years and the dropoff routine was part of the curriculum and the parents just had to sign in put stuff in cubbies and say goodbye it was up to us to help with clothing shoes bathroom these tasks are the very things that preschool is all about along with social emotional growth and the curriculum of working with the group physical play creativity etc think op preschool has burdened the parents too much find that the above mentioned drop off routine is insane worked in daycare for years and we literally had parents drop the kids off and put whatever they had in their cubby that it plain and simple if the kiddos needed supplies we wrote it on their daily sheet with verbal reminder we signed the kiddos in sent them or took them to the potty depending on age and tended to any other immediate needs they had like diaper changes or feeding with infants do disagree with your point about telling the kiddos you love them saying love you nowadays has multiple meanings friends tell friends they love each other even at young age and think it important to know that they are loved and cared for by the people who take care of them for roughly 40 hours week so we can work on the flip side just had my first baby about weeks ago and he starts daycare on friday so we will see what kinds of things are different when in the reversed role point think what most vexing is how complicated the drop off op is describing above certain daycare could reduce some of the required drop of steps required to make it easier for both parents and promise of pizza party if the entire class turns them in on time did realize it was also applicable to some daycares but if it an option for them definitely not strange and be all for filling it out to help my daycare get funding from the state though also would qualify the excessive fundraisers are certainly annoying though why should the parents after paying an arm and leg be punished for the daycare center not paying their employees enough worked in daycare too for many years and as nanny obviously every family is different so it impossible to give generalization that applies to all families but worked pretty much exclusively with children and under these little babies did need love many where there full time from early morning till late evening five days week we helped comfort them when they woke up crying from their sleep we held them when they tripped and got hurt we watched out for them to make sure none of the other children hurt them we talked to them sang to them read to them worried about them and thought about them after we went home we often had too many kid damn state ratios and many at the age are just dying for love and affection maybe people are thinking more with older children and that could understand but those little toddlers told us they loved us and during they day they truly needed our affection when their parents were gone we tried to keep the teachers consistent in those rooms because the littles bonded so strongly and the vast majority of parents valued affectionate teachers they loved that their little toddler got love attention and got to be held while they were away they loved when their little boy or girl ran into the room to give us hug because they loved us too it meant so much to new parents when they came to pick up their babe an ear whenever they need it you stay in touch even if you move or no longer have the opportunity to stay in contact everyday love implies the intent to maintain permanent bond everything else is just caring also important but different than love not looking to pawn off my responsibilities pay them have to work there is no logical reason why sign in has to involve me signing in to two separate systems my kid writing their name and my kid moving rock that is just unnecessary complication for no reason also if they make me start paying as soon as walk in the door and what am paying them for is them to care of my child then why is it so much to ask for them to take them to the bathroom and get them to wash their hands yes enjoy the end of the day chit chat with my care provider my son goes to an in home daycare so its the same people throughout his toddlerhood so want to get to know the people his is spending the majority of his day with we actually pulled him out of facility pretty quickly because did like the way the infant teacher communicated she would always answer my questions very vaguely or would be too focused on baby talking at my son to give me proper conversation do try to overstay my welcome just hang around for like minutes since my son is usually finishing up snack time or playing outside my provider is pretty chatty herself she usually tells me about her weekend or house projects or kids or whatever also like showing my son that am comfortable at his daycare and its not somewhere we need to just rush away from at the end of the day removed do understand checking supplies in the morning at dropoff are you really going to run back home or to the store and run back to daycare after dropoff if something is missing check it at the end of the day or once or twice week taking the kid to the bathroom can happen before they leave if it bothers op so much as can sunblock just because she does want to be bothered to do it does make it the teacher responsibility but trust me some parents do feel it is so the teacher is dealing with taking care of those kids needs while also trying to welcome the whole 20 30 other kids in right like have clue what your kid usually uses and yes checking at pick up makes ton more sense and still not even every day we had parents that would check supplies every day and it was so annoying we ended up keeping those kid things in their backpacks so parents could be obsessive without disrupting yes but sign in into two different systems plus the kid writes thier name on paper plus they have to find rock in big pile of rocks that has their name on it and move it it big much is my only point and the supplies my only point was why do they have to be in separate locations for me to check and then on top of it later it turns out there is 4th location we were never told about where all of our cloth diapers we have been looking for for months are mean you re really under an illusion if you don think you daycare provider is primary caregiver don mean to be rude but if you work full time they probably spend as many or more waking hours with your kid as you do you might pay the bills and make the macro decisions but on day to day level your daycare providers is responsible for the emotional well being of your child if that not primary caretaker then don know what is we love our son teachers and know they truly love and care for him it comforting to know that they are taking care of him when he falls down or is feeling sick his teachers even babysit on the weekends sometimes he had sitter his first year and she loved him so much too the more the merrier they re our village agree to disagree we can all have different criteria for what primary caregiver you have figured out how much your kids go through by now you should be checking those places *every day* and as another commentor said are you going to go get things in the morning if you re low just check at pickup once week know what your kid goes through and supply them with what they need and how have you not asked about the location on expensive cloth diapers for months you are also seriously stuck on that rock thing your kid is learning their name and helping themselves transition into school doing that it not your job to move the rock it your kid first activity of school for the day your child not the only child in the class drop off sounds over exaggerated it should be sign in and your child should know the rest at years old imagine having 20 year old with only one or two teachers also it should always be the parents responsibility to keep personal information up to date daycares don change their information often but they should also inform the parents and agree with not telling child you love them but not for that reason children should feel loved and able to trust their caregivers can tell you from experience that the waitlist doesn matter if they know you or like you they will fit you in also they will negotiate days you need and pricing if they really want you like you got lot of money or you donate to them we are required to hand out flyers at my job to every parents maybe that why my boss will even tell us to write the kids names on each one some kids are there from the crack of dawn til closing time and they just go home eat bathe and they re back again feel like we are very important part of their lives thank you you don know how sad it is to see child you ve known since they were weeks old grow up and go to elementary and not see them again wonder if any parents know
